Suffolk Libraries

Elizabethan Insults For Shakespeare Week 2016

Mar 10, 2016 • Matt Shenton

Shakespeare Week runs from 14-20 March 2016 and is a national annual celebration giving primary school children a chance to learn more about William Shakespeare.

This reminded me of a fun activity I ran a few years ago which encouraged Key Stage 3 pupils to create their own Shakespearean insults!

Using the Shakespeare Insult Generator pupils start a sentence with ‘thou’ then add a word from the following three slides until they have a assembled a cutting Elizabethan insult such as ‘thou droning, pox marked, flap-dragon’!

This was a fun starter and also we ran a competition for the funniest combination of insults.

What are you waiting for thou infectious, half-faced, foot-licker! Get cracking!
